009package imagingbook.spectral.dft;
010
011/**
012 * Interface specifying all one-dimensional DFT/FFT implementations.
013 */
014public interface Dft1d {
015        
016        public interface Float extends Dft1d {
017                /**
018                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT forward transformation on the supplied data.
019                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
020                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
021                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
022                 */
023                void forward(float[] gRe, float[] gIm);
024                
025                /**
026                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
027                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
028                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
029                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
030                 */
031                void inverse(float[] GRe, float[] GIm);
032                
033                /**
034                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
035                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
036                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
037                 * 
038                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
039                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
040                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
041                 */
042                void transform(float[] inRe, float[] inIm, boolean forward);
043                
044                default void checkSize(float[] re, float[] im, int n) {
045                        if (re.length != n || im.length != n)
046                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of size " + n);
047                }
048                
049                default void checkSize(float[] re, float[] im) {
050                        if (re.length != im.length)
051                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
052                }
053                
054                /**
055                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 1D data.
056                 * @param re the real part of the data
057                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
058                 * @return a 1D array of magnitude values
059                 */
060                default float[] getMagnitude(float[] re, float[] im) {
061                        checkSize(re, im);
062                        final int n = re.length;
063                        float[] mag = new float[n];
064                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
065                                float a = re[i];
066                                float b = im[i];
067                                mag[i] = (float) Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
068                        }
069                        return mag;
070                }
071                
072        }
073        
074        public interface Double extends Dft1d {
075                
076                /**
077                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT forward transformation on the supplied data.
078                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
079                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
080                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
081                 */
082                void forward(double[] gRe, double[] gIm);
083                
084                /**
085                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
086                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
087                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
088                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
089                 */
090                void inverse(double[] GRe, double[] GIm);
091                
092                /**
093                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
094                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
095                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
096                 * 
097                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
098                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
099                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
100                 */
101                void transform(double[] inRe, double[] inIm, boolean forward);
102                
103                default void checkSize(double[] re, double[] im, int n) {
104                        if (re.length != n || im.length != n)
105                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of size " + n);
106                }
107                
108                default void checkSize(double[] re, double[] im) {
109                        if (re.length != im.length)
110                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("arrays for real/imagingary parts must be of same size");
111                }
112                
113                /**
114                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 1D data.
115                 * @param re the real part of the data
116                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
117                 * @return a 1D array of magnitude values
118                 */
119                default double[] getMagnitude(double[] re, double[] im) {
120                        checkSize(re, im);
121                        final int n = re.length;
122                        double[] mag = new double[n];
123                        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
124                                double a = re[i];
125                                double b = im[i];
126                                mag[i] = (double) Math.sqrt(a*a + b*b);
127                        }
128                        return mag;
129                }
130        }
131        
132}
